exercises.explanation: The <em> element is used to define emphasised text.

exercises.explanation: The <strong> element is used to bolden text.
exercises.description: Create a paragraph with at least one word bolded.

errorHints.message: Try using the <strong> tag to bolden your text.
Remember to close the <strong> tag properly.

exercises.title: Underline Tag <u>
exercises.explanation: The <u> element is used to underline text.
exercises.description: Create a paragraph with everything underlined.

errorHints.message: Try using the <u> tag to underline your text.
Remember to close the <u> tag properly.

exercises.title: Heading Tags <h1> to <h6>
exercises.explanation: Heading tags are used to define headings. They range from <h1> to <h6>, with <h1> being the largest.
exercises.example:
This is the largest heading

This is a smaller heading

This is the smallest heading
exercises.description: Create a fourth-level heading that contains any short text of your choice.

errorHints.message: Make sure to use the correct tag.
Try using the <h4> tag for your heading.
Remember to close the <h4> tag properly.

exercises.title: Highlight Tag <mark>
exercises.explanation: The <mark> element is used to highlight text. Fun fact: you can use CSS to change its background color!
exercises.description: Create a paragraph with the first word highlighted.

errorHints.message: Try using the <mark> tag to highlight your text.
Remember to close the <mark> tag properly.
Make sure the first word is highlighted

exercises.title: Hyperlink Tag <a>
exercises.explanation: The <a> element is used to create hyperlinks.
exercises.description: Create a hyperlink <a> that points to 'https://example.com' with any visible text of your choice.

errorHints.message: Make sure to use the correct tag.
Try using the <a> tag with the href attribute.
Ensure the href value is 'https://example.com' and the tag is closed properly.

exercises.title: Image Tag
exercises.explanation: The element is used to embed images.
exercises.example: Here is an image:
exercises.description: Insert an image with the source set to 'image.jpg' and alt text of your choice.

errorHints.message: Check that you're using the correct tag for images.
The tag needs both src and alt attributes.
The src should be 'image.jpg', and remember is self-closing in HTML5.

exercises.title: List Tag <ul> and List Item tag <li>
exercises.explanation: The <ul> element is used to create unordered lists, and the <li> element is used for list items.
exercises.description: Create an unordered list <ul> with exactly three list items <li>, each containing any text.

errorHints.message: Check that you're using the correct tags for lists.
An unordered list uses <ul> and <li> tags.
Remember to wrap all <li> elements inside <ul> and close all tags properly.

exercises.title: Table Container <table>, Table Row <tr> and Table Data <td>
exercises.explanation: The <table> element is used to create tables, <tr> for table rows, and <td> for table data cells.
exercises.description: Create a table with two rows and two cells, each containing any text.

errorHints.message: Make sure to use table tags correctly.
Tables use <table>, <tr>, and <td> tags.
Close all tags in the correct order: table -> row -> cell.

exercises.title: Button Tag <button>
exercises.explanation: The <button> element creates a clickable button.
exercises.description: Create a button with the text 'Submit'.

errorHints.message: Make sure to use the <button> tag.
Place the button text inside <button> and </button>.
Close the <button> tag properly.

exercises.title: Span Tag <span>
exercises.explanation: The <span> element is an inline container used for styling or grouping text.
exercises.example: This is a red word inside a sentence.
exercises.description: Create a paragraph with one word wrapped in a <span> and styled with red text.

errorHints.message: Use <span> to wrap the word you want to style.
Apply inline CSS with style="color: red;".

exercises.explanation: The <div> element is a block-level container used to group other elements together, often for styling or layout purposes.
exercises.example: This is inside a div.
exercises.description: Create a <div> that contains a paragraph saying 'Hello World!' and has a yellow background.

errorHints.message: Use the <div> tag to create a container.

errorHints.message: Nest <strong> inside each <li>.
